comment: Too smart to have to put up with dumb college kids. Hates the system and lack of common sense. Allows a tool sheet for test. No plotting graphs and all that useless stuff. Only basic math skills needed.

He is a little acary at first.  He is very clear though.  There is no book and no home work.  Its boring to go to class , but if you go and most don't you will get an A.His tests are very long. He only has 3 tests and a final exam he drops lowest regular test.  So you basically have 3 requred tests and no homework.  he has a very clear free website

Has no interest whether you learn/understand the material or not.Thank God for tool sheets and his website. Has no interest in getting to know you. Will demean you if you ask a question. Brilliant when it comes to Statistics, but should in no way be a teacher. Expects you to have the vocabulary of an Oxford grad. Does not seem to enjoy teaching.
The worst teacher I have ever taken.  I just stopped going after it was too late to drop the class.

Math better be your strong point if you plan to take his class. He is hard to understand and EXTREMELY moody. He made it difficult to ask questions. Honestly, he is an a**. On the other hand, his study guides were great! He is not a difficult grader.

Do not buy the book, however if you choose to he will tell you what chapters go along with what he is teaching.  To be honest, he is very hard.  He teaches using strange techniques and nothing is by the book.  He does allow study guides for the test, but they are still difficult. He grades harshly. I got a B and this was my only B out of 40 hours.

The class work is directly based on the course page. The instructor actually writes the webpage. And plenty of students have been burned by not attending, and by attempting the copy/paste approach. Comprehension beyond copy/paste is required. And the textbook option is discussed upfront, as is the teaching approach.
unfair.....If he hates you he shows it directly....wouldnt take him again if my life depended on it........Thanx to his website i passed the class......

DO NOT buy the book. He doesn't use it. His website is all you need. Skip class: even his lectures are pointless and worthless, and attendance is optional. Copy/paste case study formats from his site for your toolsheets to use during tests, and you'll get an A like I did. Don't bother asking him questions.

Easy class if you can teach yourself--wouldn't take him if I was bad at math and/or needed assistance from the teacher. There is really no need to go to class; all the information is on his website. But show up if you wished to be entertained--he can be very moody. Make a good tool sheet and you'll be fine.

He is very intelligent... extremely. Unfortunately, he does not have social skills and cannot explain details clearly. He gets off subject easily and gives useless information. He does not use a book so you're unable to go through chapters you may not understand. If math is not a stronger subject for you, do not take his course.

I agree with eveyone here his class in not mandatory to attend. His way of teaching can be a bit confusing. But, don't despair everything you need to know about his class and passing his test can be found on his page. He gives puts every test he's ever given since 1998 on his webpage. Also your tool sheet is key.Make a good one you'll get an A.

Alverson is an interesting one...I never went to class and did fine, but he is so hard to understand...and pretty harsh. Use his website if you take him and don't worry about missing class...your not missing anything. I wouldn't take him again even though I did fine in the class.

Three exams with four case studies and you can drop the lowest. Plus the final, which is worth 40% and is cumulative. His web site is key to the class and it isn't necessary to attend if you are good at teaching yourself. Do not have to buy the textbook. He is very eccentric and extremely confusing, so only take this class if you can teach yourself

easy class/ posts test online/ allows note sheet during tests/bad pessonality/ ignores questions and is rude to students/ do not take if you need support from intructor...take him if you are ok with teaching yourself

Wow.. I didn't expect the negative ratings to be that bad but they are 100% true. This guy is useless when it comes to delivering the material. Tossing dice around and regurgitating clinical trial data is not learning statistics. FAIL 0/10

As an adult learner, self motivated, and attended each class, this was the worst professor that I have had at KSU. No homework, no using the book, not approachable at all and very rude to students. Inexcusable and speaks over your head to intimidate.

The course is straightforward, taught from materials on a webpage: notes, keys from past classes, including finals. You can practically teach yourself just from the webpage. This is just a required intro course, nothing fancy or advanced.
He is the worst teacher EVER!!!! I have never had a teacher with such a disdain for teaching.  I can't understand why is in the teaching profession. Do not under circmumstances take this teacher.
Worst class I have ever taken in college! He teaches unusable statistics so you do not learn anything at all! Good luck if you take this professor.

Alverson isn't teaching useable statistics. I had hopes this class would prepare me for some computational work in finance and other areas. Doesn't even use the book. I had to drop the course. He's a bit of an !@#% to some students too. There's got to be a better choice for my educational dollar.
No Comments
No Comments

Do not buy the text book. Ive made all A's on his tests and I have never been good at math. Some of his lectures are long and boring, but sometimes he says some funny stuff. Print out previous tests from online(on his website) and create your tool sheet during class.

Alverson has a unique way of doing things. Attendance isnt neccesary bceasue he posts all past tests and notes on the internet so you can use this to your advantage. MY ADVICE FOR TESTS: For his tool sheets, use your analitic narrative, or steps on how to do the problem. I had a 85 prefinal, 92 post. just use the right tool sheets and youll be good
he was good, his website for the class is awesome, he puts a lot of time into helping us and he will do everything to make sure you pass. GRADES VERY VERY FAIR

I agree with him being a cool teacher yet abrasive, and I agree with the class being easy. I hate math too. If you take this as a req but dont plan to use stats again, GREAT CLASS, otherwise: this will not teach you stats. Youll get an A but that's b/c of the tool sheet. Just keep it in mind. It's easy to pass but doesnt give you a foundation.
GREAT!  Has a hard time with his lazer pointer, but I would recomend him to anyone!

He is definately different.  most eccentric teacher I've ever had. I did love that there was no book to buy and that you can use the tool sheet.  The only real complaint I have is that he talks down to you if you ask a question.  He tries to be intimidating.  abrasive, but funny. If you have a good tool sheet and you study, you'll pass.

Love Mr.Alverson. He is hard to understand and he goes pretty fast, but if you have the "tool sheet" in your test, you are good to go. He does not use a text book, and everything is on his website. I hate Math and I got an A in this class. Attendance not mandatory.

Attendance is not mandatory.  There are 3 test and he drops the lowest.  HE allows us to use a "tool sheet" which is basically your pre-organized sheet of notes to asist you on all test. He doesn't teach that well but the course is reallly simple and the tool sheet helps alot

He is awesome. The best math professor you can imaging. No text book, no homework, no mondatory attendance. His entire course is online, moreover he posts all tests since 1998, so you can study them as much as you can. Moreover, he allows two side sheet of paper where you can write whatever you think can help you on test. He is great, just great!

I have to disagree with most people here, Mr. Alverson really spent no time going over material relevant to the tests.  The tests were long and convoluted.  There are better profs then this, my dad for one, who concluded with me that his grading was inconsistant and ineffective.  Bottom line this was one of the worst classes I have had at KSU.

He as different way of teaching the material that eliminates all the crap that you need. Rough and abrassive is his personality, but once you get passed that he's a great teacher. The best advise I could give is lisen and use your tool sheets.
Nice guy and he takes the time to explain the material in an effective way.

i found his technique very confusing, so i withdrew from the class. he doesn't use a book, has online notes, and all we did was play with marbles. i had no idea what was going on. i felt like he didn't do much teaching. like an online course at at school.

I took his class in the summer and it was at a fast pace however the notes online were confusing and the questions on the exam where more difficult than the practice problems.If you are an older student who may need more help consider another instructor.

I like this teacher for a few reasons.  First of all, there is no book, only what he deems necessary for the course.  There is a LOT of hands on, which helps tremendously.  Everything you would need to know is on a website maintained by him.
Take his class if at all possible.  Prof Alverson is an awesome, very intelligent teacher.  He knows what he is talking about and does a great job of conveying it to students.
I agree with all the messages so far.  Alverson is fantastic.
Hooray for professor Alverson!!!!!!!
Mr. Alverson is a completely unconventional, cool teacher.  He understands the material and does a good job of representing it.  I highly recommend him.
He is so funny and a great teacher.  I hate math, but I love his class.  He allows a tool sheet for every test, and drops the lowest test score completely.  My favorite teacher ever.
Awesome teacher... simply awesome.
